edge: Riggs drives past a prairie dog and throws a cigar at it, causing a raccoon to signal a mink to release a boulder that pushes Riggs' car to the edge of a cliff.
Riggs yells at a raccoon for screaming after he throws a cigar at a prairie dog, and the raccoon throws the cigar back to Riggs.
Dan talks to Lyman on the phone while planning to check up on a co-worker.
Riggs calls up Lyman to tell him that he quits after being thrown off a cliff by a boulder released by a mink signaled by a raccoon.
Dan is given the task of turning the forest of Rocky Springs into a residential development by Lyman.
Dan's son Tyler objects to his father's plan to turn Rocky Springs into a residential development.
Dan's wife Tammy is unhappy in Rocky Springs and misses their lives in Chicago.
The animals led by the raccoon refuse to sit back and watch their forest being destroyed.
Dan experiences an attack by a grizzly bear while working in Rocky Springs.
Tyler warns his father that many have tried to settle Rocky Springs but they all failed because it is a forest reserve.
relationship between Dan and his father where Dan warns his father about the failure of others in settling Rocky Springs
many have tried to settle Rocky Springs but they all failed

Dan signs orders to have a drill sergeant capture and cage all the animals

relationship between Tammy and Dan
